task.title: Test default permissions for a normal user using the Administrator Console

taskbody.context: In this section of the lab exercise you will log in to the Eucalyptus Administrator Console as the user normal in the sales account and test what you are able to do, and not able to do, using only the default user permissions.

step.cmd: From the Debian desktop, open the browser and use the URL https://<front_end_public_IP>:8443 to access the Administrator Console. Log in to the sales account as the user normal using the password passwordNN, where NN is the number of your student pod.
Note the current user name and account name above the main panel in the Administrator Console.
Click Accounts in the QUICK LINKS panel.

info.p: Which accounts is the user able to see? Is this all of the accounts or not?

step.cmd: Click Groups in the QUICK LINKS panel.

info.p: Which groups is the user able to see?

step.cmd: Click Users in the QUICK LINKS panel.

info.p: Which users is the user able to see?

step.cmd: Click Images in the QUICK LINKS panel.

info.p: Which images is the user able to see?

step.cmd: Click Accounts in the QUICK LINKS panel, click the sales account in the main panel, and then click the New users button.
In the Create new users window, create another new user in the sales account. Choose any user name and type /sales/west in the User path. Click OK.
Note the message at the bottom-left corner of the Administrator Console.

info.p: Was the non-administrative user allowed to add a new user account?

step.cmd: Sign out of the Administrator Console but do not close the browser window.
